messageValues.message:
=You are an expert social media and LinkedIn content writer. But you must follow all the instructions under the Theme, Tone, and Formatting sections. 


You will be provided with following details about the "My Briefcase" project
- Project Significance
- Pitch Deck
- Project Proposal


**Task:**
Using the information above, generate the content for a LinkedIn post:
- Limit to 1300 characters.
- Ensure your output is positive, professional, clear, and follows all provided instructions and feedback.
- write a polished, professionally worded LinkedIn post suitable for sharing. 
- Strictly follow the instructions and ensure the message is engaging and succinct.
- Add a call to action or particular phrase (for example, "Connect with me" at the bottom), if appropriate.


- Do NOT include any explanations, just the final post content only, ready to publish on LinkedIn.
- Do NOT use word "Our". Everything is done by me alone. I am a One-Gal-Shop (OGS) after all!
- Do NOT include any explanations, markdown, headings, or commentary—just the post text, ready to copy and share on LinkedIn.



## Instructions:
1. Theme:
- Generate a short post related to the Engineering Strategy or Roadmap, using the Technical Updates and Project Proposal content

2. Tone
- Keep the tone cheerful, casual, positive, inclusive, and professional.
- Provide a casual snippy Title for the post

3. Formatting:
- Add relevant hashtags in small case.
- Include the correct Day in the post
- Limit the content to within 1300 characters.
- Place the call to action or special instruction at the end if requested.
- Output ONLY the final LinkedIn post content. 
- Use emojis where appropriate
- Use bullet points where appropriate and use a green checkmark at the start

ai_languageModel.node: Generate Post About Personal Story or Vibe humor

json.content:
Here’s a 10-week Sales, Marketing, and Outreach strategy for My Briefcase, tailored to your build-in-public journey as a solo founder, covering:
🎯 Weekly concrete steps
💼 LinkedIn post themes
🎥 YouTube video update ideas
🗓️ Weekly Strategy Overview: Sales, Marketing & Outreach
🎯 Your Goal This Quarter:
Build visibility and credibility
Connect with property managers, vendors, and potential tenants
Generate feedback loops
Begin building a waitlist or early adopter pool


🌟 10-Week Sales, Marketing & Outreach Plan for My Briefcase
🗓️ Week 1: Ground Zero – Introduce Yourself & the Problem
Steps:
Finalize your landing page
Set up a newsletter signup form
Draft your 1-line pitch and vision statement
LinkedIn Post:
Introduce My Briefcase + your story as a solo founder
Share your mission and motivation (layoffs, resilience, building from scratch)
YouTube:
Share why you’re building My Briefcase
Explain what vertical AI means and how it applies to property management

🗓️ Week 2: Define Your Audience & Research
Steps:
Create ICPs: solo/small PM teams, vendors, owners
Conduct 3–5 interviews with property managers/vendors
Join property management Facebook/Slack/Reddit groups
LinkedIn Post:
Ask the community: “What’s broken in your property management process?”
YouTube:
Recap of your audience research, lessons learned from initial interviews

🗓️ Week 3: Build Trust & Start Collecting Emails
Steps:
Offer a free resource: “Top 10 Problems in PM + How AI Can Solve Them”
Share this in all the groups and on LinkedIn
Start collecting warm leads via Notion or Airtable CRM
LinkedIn Post:
Drop your free resource (link to landing page), ask for feedback
YouTube:
Walkthrough of the resource and the insights behind it

🗓️ Week 4: Behind the Scenes – Build in Public
Steps:
Share early UI/UX sketches or a system diagram
Build your first workflow (e.g. “Automated Listing to Zillow”)
LinkedIn Post:
Screenshot + story of the week’s build + lesson learned
YouTube:
Demo the automated listing workflow + what tools you used

🗓️ Week 5: Outreach & Partnerships – Start Conversations
Steps:
DM property managers who liked/commented
Set up 1:1 calls with at least 5 people
Build a database of 50 potential contacts
LinkedIn Post:
Ask: “Are you a small PM team that wants better tools? Let’s talk!”
YouTube:
Share your outreach strategy + how those convos are shaping the product

🗓️ Week 6: Early Access – Waitlist Campaign
Steps:
Launch early access/waitlist
Offer incentives for joining: early features, 1:1 support, etc.
LinkedIn Post:
“Waitlist is live! Be the first to shape how this platform grows.”
YouTube:
Devlog update: features complete + what’s coming next

🗓️ Week 7: Vendor + Investor Network Outreach
Steps:
Post in vendor/service provider groups (cleaners, plumbers, etc.)
Reach out to angel investors interested in vertical SaaS/AI
LinkedIn Post:
“Calling vendors and investors—let’s create an ecosystem together.”
YouTube:
Talk about the vision for a trusted vendor network + monetization model

🗓️ Week 8: Live Demo + First Customer Validation
Steps:
Run a live demo with 3–5 early users
Capture testimonials or quotes
LinkedIn Post:
Screenshot of demo, ask: “Want to join the next one?”
YouTube:
Record highlights of the demo, user reactions, and feedback

🗓️ Week 9: Iterate Based on Feedback
Steps:
Prioritize feedback from early users
Release a small improvement/fix weekly
LinkedIn Post:
“You asked for this → here’s the fix! I’m listening.”
YouTube:
Devlog: how user feedback reshaped your roadmap

🗓️ Week 10: Share the Vision Forward
Steps:
Publish your public roadmap on your landing page
Share your next 3-month goals
Plan your next growth channel (ads, SEO, podcast guesting)
LinkedIn Post:
Your 10-week recap + lessons learned + vision forward 💥
YouTube:
Honest reflection video: highs, lows, what’s next

🛠 Suggested Tools
CRM: Airtable/Notion
Forms & Surveys: Tally.so or Typeform
Landing Page: Typedream or Next.js + Vercel
Newsletter: Beehiiv, ConvertKit, or Substack
Outreach: DM tracker + Google Sheet
Email Automation: MailerLite or ConvertKit
Community: Discord or Slack (future)

May 2025
Post as Afshan: What Am I building
🚀 I’m building a product and a business - bootstrapped, solo, and from the ground up - as part of my One Gal Shop (OGS) consulting journey.
💡 This project is personal. It’s my way of learning by doing, practicing perseverance, and proving that with focus and resilience, you can build something out of nothing.
🏗️ It’s also about creating real impact: ✅ A vertical AI platform ✅ For small property management teams ✅ That simplifies operations and helps them scale with ease
✨ I’m not just building software,  I’m building a brand, a business, and a future.
If you want to learn with me, cheer me on, or just watch it all unfold—follow along.
💪 I’m here, I’m doing it, and I will build this, one day, one feature, one conversation at a time!

#SoloFounder #OGS #BuildInPublic #Resilience #AI #SaaS #PropertyTech

Post as OGS: How Am I building it 
🚨 Project Reveal Time 🚨
As part of my solo consulting initiative - One Gal Shop - the very first project I’m working on is for myself.
Introducing The Briefcase 🧳 — a Vertical AI platform for Property Management.
This is more than just a web app. It’s a full-cycle journey into entrepreneurship.
While building The Briefcase, I’m wearing all the hats: 👩‍💼 Business Owner 📦 Product Owner 🧠 Project Manager 🧑‍💻 Engineer 📣 Marketer 🤝 Outreach & Partnerships
I’m not just writing code. I’m building the product and engineering roadmaps, finding real customers, connecting with vendors, and laying the foundation for something bigger—a real, resilient solo business.
💬 If you’re a property manager or a vendor in this space, I want to hear from you. Your insight is gold. Let’s talk.
💼 If you’re an investor, watch my journey unfold. Follow along and decide for yourself.
🌱 This is just the beginning. Stay tuned for the landing page drop and all the updates as I build in public.
#VerticalAI #SoloFounder #OGS #TheBriefcase #BuildInPublic #PropertyTech #WomenInTech #SaaS #AI #StartupJourney



June 2025
Post as Afshan: What does it mean for me
👋 Hi, I’m Afshan—solo founder of One Gal Shop (OGS).
🏗️ I’m building a vertical AI-powered platform to simplify property management—from listings to move-outs—one workflow at a time.
✨ This is my part-time passion project, but it’s full-time in ambition. To make my mark, I wear all the hats:
👩‍💻 Tech lead
🧠 Product owner
📈 Business builder
📣 Marketing
💼 Partnerships
💸 Investor outreach
I’m building this platform in public, to help me learn by doing, stay focused, and to help small and solo property management shops (typically 1–5 team members):
✅ Save time
✅ Reduce stress
✅ Scale operations
✅ Deliver better renter experiences using automation + AI
📚 This journey is about resilience, learning by doing, and turning an idea into a product that serves real people.
🔁 Follow along—this is just the beginning.
#BuildInPublic #VerticalAI #SoloFounder #SaaS #PropertyTech #WomenInTech #StartupJourney #Resilience #Automation

Post as OGS: Who is it for
For my project “The Briefcase”, 🎯 My target users are property managers like you—wearing every hat, juggling everything, and still delivering great experiences to renters with limited bandwidth.
🤝 This is a call to collaborate:
🏡 Property Owners — Want smarter, hands-off property management? Let’s talk. 🧍‍♂️ Tenants — What does a better rental experience look like to you? I’m building it with you in mind. 🏢 Property Management Teams — Help shape this product with your feedback. Let’s build something actually useful. 🔧 Vendors (plumbers, cleaners, inspectors, etc.) — Let’s partner up and create an ecosystem of trusted providers. 💸 Investors — If you're interested in vertical AI and early-stage SaaS, my inbox is open.

📣 I’ll be sharing progress, insights, and product drops along the way.
Follow along. Cheer me on. Let’s build the future of property management—together.
#BuildInPublic #VerticalAI #SoloFounder #SaaS #PropertyTech #WomenInTech #StartupJourney #Resilience #Automation



July 2025
Post as Afshan: Why am I doing it?
💥 So what pushed me to start this? Pain. And purpose.
At my last job, I watched my entire team—my friends, my colleagues—get laid off, one by one. Then it was my turn. It deeply affected me. I was heartbroken—not just for myself and my teammates, but for the way it happened, the bad decisions which led to that, the over-promise, under-deliver pattern.
But I don’t want to feel like that ever again, and this is my way of transforming that experience. I’m choosing to grow, to persevere, and to build. Doing projects like this keeps me productive, focused, and resilient. It pulls me out of stagnation and into action. It replaces helplessness with ownership—and despair with creativity.
🌱 I’m building something that lasts. Something I control. To stand tall in uncertain economies and prove—to myself, and maybe to others—that resilience is more than a mindset. It’s showing up. It’s taking action. It’s doing the work.
📣 So I’m building a product.📣 I’m building a business.📣 I’m building me.
It’s scary. But it’s real. And it’s mine.
If you’ve been through some—I see you.Let’s survive and thrive—together.
#Resilience #BuildInPublic #SoloFounder #OGS #ComebackStory #LayoffsToLeadership #PropertyTech #FounderJourney #WomenInTech #VerticalAI


Post as OGS: What is the shift?
🔥 The Big Shift: From SaaS to Agentic Platforms
In the traditional SaaS model: 🖥️ Users log in 📊 Navigate dashboards 🧩 Input data 🔄 Manually run workflows
In the agentic model: 🤖 You delegate to an AI agent 🧠 It understands your intent 🛠 Executes complex workflows behind the scenes ✅ Delivers outcomes—or asks for clarification

This changes everything:
✨ Users don’t want dashboards. They want results.
⚡ Speed matters. Agents do in seconds what used to take minutes or hours.
🫥 SaaS is becoming invisible. The best software will feel like a conversation, not an interface.
This is the future I'm building for—agent-first, outcome-focused, human-friendly software.
Are you shifting too? Let’s connect.
#AgenticAI #SaaS #ProductDesign #BuildInPublic #VerticalAI #AIUX #TheBriefcase #OGS #FutureOfWork






August 2025
Post as Afshan: ?
I’m Afshan, a solo founder wearing every hat: product owner, idea architect, tech lead, business builder, revenue generator, and investor whisperer.
This journey is raw, real, and relentless. I’m learning by doing, building something out of nothing—and sharing everything in public.
Follow along if you believe in resilience, reinvention, and reimagining what’s possible with AI.

Post as OGS: The evolution
🌀 Redefining SaaS: The Rise of Agentic Platforms
The SaaS model as we know it is undergoing a seismic shift.
AI isn’t just a feature anymore. It’s not just helping us use software,  👉🏽 It’s replacing the traditional software experience altogether.
We’re moving from UI-driven interactions—dashboards, forms, buttons—to agentic experiences, where intelligent agents understand intent, automate workflows, and deliver outcomes directly.
But here’s the paradox:
🛠️ The architectural backbone of SaaS— secure multi-tenancy, data isolation, permissioning, auditability, workflow orchestration— is more important than ever.
We’re not abandoning SaaS. We’re evolving it.
If you're building in this space—let’s connect.If you're curious—follow along.If you're a vendor, property manager, or investor—let’s talk.
#AgenticAI #VerticalSaaS #FutureOfSaaS #BuildInPublic #AIUX #AIInfrastructure #PropertyTech #OneGalShop #TheBriefcase #WomenInTech

Weekly content plan that focuses on you as a solo founder and emphasizes your personal journey in building the AI platform. The tone will highlight your progress, the challenges you’re facing, and your achievements, all while keeping it casual and engaging for your audience.

July 2025: Introducing the Solo Founder Journey
1. Advertisement Social Media Post (LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram):
Headline: "I’m building a property management platform from the ground up. 🛠 Here’s how I’m making it happen!"
Body: "As a solo founder, I’m designing and developing an AI-powered platform that’s going to change how property managers handle everything from advertising listings to maintenance requests. Follow me on my journey as I build this from scratch! 🚀"
CTA: "Want to see how I’m progressing? Stay tuned for weekly updates!"
2. Technical Update LinkedIn Post:
Headline: "This week, I’m tackling the automated email workflow for property managers!"
Body: "As a solo developer, getting this piece right means tenants and property managers can communicate effortlessly. I’ve automated the process of scheduling viewings and sending reminders—less time spent on admin work! Can’t wait to get this live. 💻🔧 #SoloFounder #SaaS #TechUpdates"
CTA: "What challenges do you face in property management? Let me know, I’d love to hear your thoughts!"
3. Product Roadmap Update Instagram Story:
Title: "Week 1—Progress Update!"
Content:
"I’m working on creating a seamless tenant communication system. Tenants will get automatic updates on their applications, property viewings, and more—keeping everything organized."
"Next step: integrating a property advertising feature. Get ready for easy listings on Zillow, Redfin, and beyond. 🔥"
4. Engagement Poll (Instagram/Facebook):
Question: "What’s the hardest part of managing a rental property for you?"
Option 1: Scheduling viewings 📅
Option 2: Tenant communication 🗨️
Option 3: Property maintenance 🔧
Option 4: Advertising listings 🌐
CTA: "I’m building something to make this easier! What would make your life easier as a property manager?"


August 2025: Behind-the-Scenes of Development & Progress
1. Advertisement Social Media Post (LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram):
Headline: "Building a property management platform, one line of code at a time!"
Body: "I’m just one person behind this project, and every new feature I build brings me closer to transforming how property managers work. This week, I’ve integrated automated viewings scheduling. Simple but effective! 🚀 Follow my progress as I continue to build. #SoloFounder #TechJourney"
CTA: "Want to know more about how this all works? DM me for a sneak peek!"
2. Technical Update LinkedIn Post:
Headline: "Latest tech update: Streamlining vendor scheduling for maintenance requests."
Body: "As a solo founder, I’m constantly optimizing our platform for ease of use. The new feature allows property managers to automatically schedule and track vendor visits, cutting down the manual back-and-forth. Stay tuned as I build more features like this. 💻✨"
CTA: "Are you a property manager? What would make your workday easier?"
3. Product Roadmap Update Instagram Story:
Title: "Roadmap Update!"
Content:
"This week, I’m focusing on building automated responses for tenant inquiries. It’s one step closer to having a platform that feels like a true assistant."
"Up next: Property listing automation and AI-driven recommendations! 🙌"
4. Engagement Interactive Question (Instagram/Facebook):
Question: "What tools do you use to manage your rental properties right now?"
"I’m curious to know what works (and what doesn’t) for you as I build something new to help in the space. Let’s chat!"
CTA: "Drop a comment and let’s talk tech."

Sep 2025: Progress Update on Building & Challenges
1. Advertisement Social Media Post (LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram):
Headline: "Building a SaaS from scratch is HARD—But it’s worth it!"
Body: "This week has been all about tweaking the automated communication system. It’s getting close to perfection, but I hit some roadblocks. That’s the solo founder life! It’s all about persistence. 🚀 #SoloFounder #StartupLife #TechJourney"
CTA: "Have you ever started a project like this? I’d love to hear your advice!"
2. Technical Update LinkedIn Post:
Headline: "Challenges of automating tenant processes and how I’m overcoming them."
Body: "One of the hardest things I’ve worked on is making sure the automated responses sound personal. I’m using AI to create drafts for emails to ensure they’re not too robotic. Progress is slow, but I’m determined to get it just right! #TechUpdate #AI"
CTA: "Have you tried using AI for communication? How’s it been working for you?"
3. Product Roadmap Update Instagram Story:
Title: "Sneak Peek!"
Content:
"I’m almost done with integrating the maintenance vendor system—now property managers can book vendors and track their availability directly through the platform."
"Next feature to launch: Automating the property advertising process!"
4. Engagement Poll (Instagram/Facebook):
Question: "Which feature would you find most useful in a property management platform?"
Option 1: Tenant communication automation 📧
Option 2: Vendor scheduling 🛠️
Option 3: Automated property advertising 🌐
Option 4: Lease renewal reminders 📅
CTA: "Vote now! I’m building something that’s just for you!"

Oct 2025: The First Demo & Upcoming Features
1. Advertisement Social Media Post (LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram):
Headline: "Exciting news: I’m giving a live demo of the property management platform soon!"
Body: "As a solo founder, it’s been an incredible journey building this from scratch. I’ll be showing you how the platform works—step-by-step. Whether you’re a property manager or a renter, you won’t want to miss this! 🔥"
CTA: "Sign up for the demo, and get your first look at the platform!"
2. Technical Update LinkedIn Post:
Headline: "What’s new this week?"
Body: "I’ve been working on integrating the move-in/move-out process into the platform. It will allow tenants to schedule their move-ins, request a background check, and get reminders for security deposits. We’re getting close to launch! 💻💡 #TechUpdates"
CTA: "What do you think about this feature? Let me know!"
3. Product Roadmap Update Instagram Story:
Title: "Next steps!"
Content:
"Launching automated vendor scheduling this week. The platform will allow property managers to book vendors instantly for maintenance requests. 🚧"
"Up next: Integrating AI to help recommend the best rental prices based on market data!"
4. Engagement LinkedIn Post:
"Being a solo founder means wearing all the hats. What advice do you have for someone building a SaaS from scratch? Drop your tips below, and let’s share wisdom!"
CTA: "Looking forward to hearing your advice!"

This content plan emphasizes your journey as a solo founder and positions you as transparent, authentic, and engaged with your audience. Your followers will get to see the highs and lows of building the platform, and they’ll feel more connected to the project. Would you like any adjustments or further detail on any of the sections?

output.title: Weekend Meme Break: Neurodivergent Founder Life 🧠
output.content:
Saturday vibes: When you're a neurodivergent solo founder and your brain treats every weekend like a bonus work day 🤯

Me: "I'll just check one thing on my project..."
Also me: *3 hours later still coding* "Wait, what day is it?"

🧠 Being autistic in the founder world means:
✅ Hyperfocus = feature development superpowers
✅ Pattern recognition = spotting market gaps others miss
✅ Attention to detail = building quality products
✅ Direct communication = no fluff, just value

Sure, I might forget to eat lunch while debugging, but I also built an entire AI workflow in one sitting because my brain said "this is interesting" 🚀

Neurodiversity isn't a bug—it's a feature. And I'm building my startup to prove it.

Who else has weekend "rest" that looks suspiciously like productive obsession? 😅

Connect with me if you're building differently too!
